Dialogue.Line: I wish I could go to the ball too...
And why would the Prince ever want to dance with you, Cinderella? You're nothing but a servant girl.
I may not have your fine clothes or your jewels, but I have something you'll never have... a kind heart.
And that, my dear, is more precious than any jewel. Now, let's get you ready for the ball.
But how? I have nothing to wear...
With a little bit of magic, anything is possible. Bibbidi-Bobbidi-Boo!
Oh, Fairy Godmother! It's beautiful! But... what if they recognize me?
Trust in yourself, Cinderella. Your kindness and grace will shine through, no matter what you wear.
I will, Fairy Godmother. I will.
Remember, the magic will only last until midnight. You must be home by then.
I understand. Thank you, Fairy Godmother.
Off you go, my dear. Enjoy the ball!
